intro: Ageratina tenuis, commonly known as slender ageratum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, featuring narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, white or blue-violet flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Ageratina tenuis is also valued for its use in traditional medicine in some cultures.
